alert.note: Alert for Western Crook (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 7:31PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Crook County through 800 PM MDT... At 731 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Carlile, or 21 miles west of Sundance, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Devils Tower Junction. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for northeastern Wyoming.
